dua_transliteration: maa shaa’ allaahu laa quwwata illaa billaah
english_translation: (This is) what Allah wills, and there is no might except by Allah
dua_title: Dua when seeing something you like about yourself or your possessions

dua_transliteration: al-laahum-ma sal-lee ‘alaa aali [the giver of the charity]
english_translation: O Allah send prayers upon the family of [the giver of charity]
dua_title: Dua for the person who gives in charity
dua_arabic: ٱللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى آلِ [ فُلاَنٍ  ]
additional_info: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Abu Aufa : Whenever a person came to the Prophet (May peace be upon him) with his alms, the Prophet (May peace be upon him) would say, "O Allah! Send your Blessings upon so and so."My father went to the Prophet (May peace be upon him) with his alms and the Prophet (May peace be upon him) said, "O Allah! Send your blessings upon the offspring of Abu Aufa
reference: "Sahih al-Bukhari 1497, In-book reference : Book 24, Hadith 98, USC-MSA web (English) reference : Vol. 2, Book 24, Hadith 574"
urdu_translation: اے اللہ ! آل [صدقہ دینے والے کا نام] کو خیر و برکت عطا فرما

dua_transliteration: allaahumma baarik lanaa fee thamarinaa, wa baarik lanaa fee madeenatinaa, wa baarik lanaa fee saa‛inaa, wa baarik lanaa fee muddinaa
english_translation: O Allah, bless our fruit for us, bless our town for us, bless our saAA for us and bless our mudd for us
dua_title: Dua upon seeing the early or premature fruit
dua_arabic: ٱللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِي ثَمَرِنَا وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي مَدِينَتِنَا وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي صَاعِنَا وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي مُدِّنَا
additional_info: Abu Huraira (Allah be pleased with him) reported that when the people saw the first fruit (of the season or of plantation) they brought it to Allah's Apostle (May peace be upon him). When he received it he said: O Allah, bless us in our fruits; and bless us in our city; and bless us in our sa's and bless us in our mudd. O Allah, Ibrahim was Thy servant, Thy friend, and Thy apostle; and I am Thy servant and Thy apostle. He (Ibrahim) made supplication to Thee for (the showering of blessings upon) Mecca, and I am making supplication to Thee for Medina just as he made supplication to Thee for Mecca, and the like of it in addition. He would then call to him the youngest child and give him these fruits.
reference: "Sahih Muslim 1373 a, In-book reference : Book 15, Hadith 538, USC-MSA web (English) reference : Book 7, Hadith 3170"
urdu_translation: اے اللہ، پھل میں برکتیں عطا فرما اور ہمارے شہر میں برکتیں عطا فرما اور ہماری فصل (فلور) کے وزن میں برکتیں عطا فرما

english_translation: Allah is the greatest

dua_transliteration: allaahummaṭ-wi lahul-ba‛eeda, wa hawwin ‛alayhi-ssafar
english_translation: O Allah shorten the distant for him and ease his journey
dua_title: Dua of the resident for the traveler
dua_arabic: ٱللَّهُمَّ اطْوِ لَهُ الأَرْضَ وَهَوِّنْ عَلَيْهِ السَّفَرَ
additional_info:
"Abu Hurairah [may Allah be pleased with him] narrated that :
                     
a man said: “O Messenger of Allah (May peace be upon him), I intend to travel, so advise 
me.” He said, “Hold fast to the Taqwa of Allah, and (say the) Takbir 
upon every elevated place.” So when the man turned away he said: “O 
Allah make near for him the distance, and ease for him the journey 
(Allāhummaṭwi lahul-arḍa wa hawwin `alaihis-safar).”"

dua_transliteration: allaahumma innee a‛oodhu bika an adilla aw udalla, aw azilla aw uzalla, aw azlima aw uzlama, aw ajhala aw yujhala ‛alayy
english_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You lest I should stray or be led astray, or slip (i.e. to commit a sin unintentionally) or be tripped, or oppress or be oppressed, or behave foolishly or be treated foolishly
dua_arabic: ٱللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ أَوْ أُضَلَّ أَوْ أَزِلَّ أَوْ أُزَلَّ أَوْ أَظْلِمَ أَوْ أُظْلَمَ أَوْ أَجْهَلَ أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَىَّ
additional_info:
"Umm Salamah narrated that :
When the Prophet (May peace be upon him) would leave his house, he would say: “In the Name of Allah, I place my trust in Allah. O Allah! We seek refuge in You from slipping unintentionally or becoming misguided, or committing oppression or being oppressed, or acting ignorantly or being treated ignorantly (Bismillāh, tawakkaltu `alallāh. Allāhumma, innā na`ūdhu bika min an nazilla aw naḍilla, aw naẓlima aw nuẓlam, aw najhala aw yujhala alainā).”
"
reference: "Sunan Abi Dawud 5094, In-book reference : Book 43, Hadith 322, English translation : Book 42, Hadith 5075"
urdu_translation: اللہ کے نام سے، میں نے اللہ ہی پر بھروسہ کیا۔ اے اللہ میں تجھ سے اس سے پناہ ماتا ہ ہوں کہ میں پھسل جاؤں یا بھٹک جاؤں یا میں کسی پر یا کوئی مجھ پر ظلم کرے یا میں جہالت میں پزھاؤں یا کوئی مجھ سے جہالت کرے۔

dua_transliteration: a‛oodh-u bikalimaat-i-llah-i-ttaammat-i min ghadabih-i wa‛iqaabih-i , washarri ‛ibaadih-i wamin hamazaat-i-shshayaateen-i wa’an yahduroon-i
english_translation: I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from His anger and punishment, and from the evil of His slaves, and from the madness and appearance of devils
dua_arabic: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّةِ مِنْ غَضَبِهِ وَعِقَابِهِ ، وَشَرِّ عِبَادِهِ وَمِنْ هَمَزَاتِ الشَّيَاطِينِ وَأَنْ يَحْضُرُونِ
additional_info:
"`Amr bin Shu`aib narrated from his father, from his grandfather, that the Messenger of Allah (May peace be upon him) said:
“When one of you becomes frightened during sleep, then let him say: ‘I seek refuge in Allah’s Perfect Words from His anger, His punishment, and the evil of His creatures, from the whisperings of the Shayatin, and that they should come (A`ūdhu bikalimātillāhit-tāmmati min ghaḍabihī wa `iqābihī wa sharri `ibādih, wa min hamazātish-shayāṭīni wa an yaḥḍurūn).’ For verily, they shall not harm him.” He said: “So `Abdullah bin `Amr used to teach it to those of his children who attained maturity, and those of them who did not, he would write it on a sheet and then hang it around his neck.”"
reference:
"Reference : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 3528
In-book reference : Book 48, Hadith 159
English translation : Vol. 6, Book 45, Hadith 3528"

english_translation: Say, "He is Allah, [who is] One (1) Allah, the Eternal Refuge. (2) He neither begets nor is born (3) Nor is there to Him any equivalent.(4)

urdu_translation: (اے نبئ مکرّم!) آپ فرما دیجئے: وہ اﷲ ہے جو یکتا ہے ﴿١﴾ اﷲ سب سے بے نیاز، سب کی پناہ اور سب پر فائق ہے ﴿٢﴾ نہ اس سے کوئی پیدا ہوا ہے اور نہ ہی وہ پیدا کیا گیا ہے ﴿٣﴾ اور نہ ہی اس کا کوئی ہمسر ہے ﴿٤﴾

dua_transliteration: Rabbana taqabbal minna innaka antas Sameeaul Aleem
english_translation: Our Lord! Accept (this service) from us: For Thou art the All-Hearing, the All-knowing
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
additional_info:
"1. This du`a was read by Ibrahim and Ismail u when they completed the building of the Ka’bah
Ref: Ibn e Kathir p. 371
2. The lesson is that a person must not be satisfied with actions only. Rather, after the action, be humble and beg Allah to accept it. This is taught from the action of Ibrahim (a.s). After completing such a lofty action he does not express pride, rather he asks Allah to accept the action"
reference: البقرة :127
urdu_translation: ہمارے پروردگار! تو ہم سے قبول فرما، تو ہی سننے واﻻ اور جاننے واﻻ ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana wa-j'alna Muslimayni laka wa min Dhurriyatina 'Ummatam Muslimatan’lak wa 'Arina Manasikana wa tub 'alayna 'innaka 'antat-Tawwabu-Raheem
english_translation: Our Lord! And make us submissive unto Thee and of our seed a nation submissive unto Thee, and show us our ways of worship, and relent toward us. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Relenting, the Merciful.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا وَٱجْعَلْنَا مُسْلِمَيْنِ لَكَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِنَآ أُمَّةً مُّسْلِمَةً لَّكَ وَأَرِنَا مَنَاسِكَنَا وَتُبْ عَلَيْنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
additional_info:
"1. This is also the du`a of Ibrahim (a.s).
2. This du’a is the end result of Ibrahim’s fear and recognition of Allah after completing actions. Whilst being obedient and subservient. One should make this du`a for obedience and subservience to Allah alone. The reason is that when the recognition of Allah I is increased in a person his realisation is also increased. Ibrahim also made du`a for his offspring. The close servants of Allah are more concerned about the spiritual welfare of their offspring especially their welfare in the Aakhirah. Another reason for praying for the off-spring is that they may, by their good deeds set a good example to future generations and the nation of Islam will benefit as a whole.
Ref: Mariful Qur’an vol. 1. P328/9"
reference: البقرة :128
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہمیں اپنا فرمانبردار بنا لے اور ہماری اوﻻد میں سے بھی ایک جماعت کو اپنی اطاعت گزار رکھ اور ہمیں اپنی عبادتیں سکھا اور ہماری توبہ قبول فرما، تو توبہ قبول فرمانے واﻻ اور رحم وکرم کرنے واﻻ ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana atina fi’dunya hasanatan’wa fil 'akhirati hasanatan’waqina 'adhaban-nar
english_translation: "Our Lord! Give unto us in the world that which is good and in the Hereafter that which is good, and guard us from the doom of Fire."
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِى ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
additional_info:
"1. Rasulullah (pbuh) used to recite this du`a very often.
Ref: Mariful Quraan P. 492 and Tafseer Mazhiri P. 403 from Anas
2. This du`a is masnun especially during tawaaf.
3. Allama Bagawi (a.s) narrates that Anas (a.s) said: Once Rasulullah (pbuh) saw a person who became so thin and weak like a bird hatching out from an egg. Nabi (pbuh) asked him: Do you make du`a to Allah? He replied: O Rasulullah (pbuh) I used to make this du`a: “O Allah! What punishment you are to give me in the Akhirah, give it to me in this world”.
Ref: Tafsir Mazhari - P 403 - from Muslim
4. Abdullah bin Saaib (a.s) relates that Rasulullah (pbuh) used to recite the above du`a between Rukn Jamah and Rukn Aswad.
Ref: Ibid - From Abu Dawud, Nasai, Ibn Hibban, Hakim
5. Abu Hasan bin Dahhak (R.A.) narrates that Anas (a.s) used to say that even if Rasulullah (pbuh) used to make du`a a hundred times he would begin with the above du`a and end off with it as well, and if he used to make two du`a then one of it used to be the above.
Ref: Ibid - Ibn Abi Shaiba
6. Naqi bin Makhlad (R.A.) narrates from Anas (a.s) the above ayah used to be in the beginning of Rasulullah’s (pbuh) du`a, the middle and at the end.
7. Anas bin Malik (a.s) narrates that Rasulullah (pbuh) used to recite the above du`a.
Ref: Ibn Kathir - P 251 - F
rom Bukhari
8. Ibn Abbas (a.s) narrates that Rasulullah (pbuh) said “I do not pass any corner (at the time of tawaaf), but I see an angel at that corner saying Ameen”. Thus when you pass by it, recite the above du`a.
Ref: Ibid"
reference: البقرة :201
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہمیں دنیا میں نیکی دے اور آخرت میں بھی بھلائی عطا فرما اور ہمیں عذاب جہنم سے نجات دے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana afrigh 'alayna sabran wa thabbit aqdamana wansurna 'alal-qawmil-kafirin
english_translation: Our Lord! Bestow on us endurance, make our foothold sure, and give us help against the disbelieving folk
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
additional_info: 1. This du’a was read by the believers when they were at war with Jaloot. Before the army confronted them, they recited this du’a.
reference: البقرة :250

additional_info: na

urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہم پر وه بوجھ نہ ڈال جو ہم سے پہلے لوگوں پر ڈاﻻ تھا

dua_transliteration: Rabbana wala tuhammilna ma la taqata lana bihi wa'fu anna waghfir lana warhamna anta mawlana fansurna 'alal-qawmil kafireen
english_translation: Our Lord! Impose not on us that which we have not the strength to bear! Pardon us, absolve us and have mercy on us, Thou, our Protector, and give us victory over the disbelieving folk.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا وَلَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِۦ ۖ وَٱعْفُ عَنَّا وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَآ ۚ أَنتَ مَوْلَىٰنَا فَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
additional_info:
"1. A narration by Abu Hurairah (a.s) in Bukhari and Muslim proves that the above du`a when made by Nabi (pbuh) was accepted.
Ref: Tafsir Mazhari Vol. 2. P. 165
2. Ibn Abbas (a.s) narrates: We, as a group were sitting in the company of Nabi (pbuh). Jibra’il (a.s) was also present. Suddenly, the sound of a door opening was heard from above. Jibra ’il (a.s) lifted his gaze to see. He then said “The door that has now opened does not open normally”.
Ref: Muslim
3. which were not given to any Rasul before you. The first is Suratul Fatihah and the second is the concluding ayah of Suratul Baqarah. If you read even one letter from it, you will attain that celestial light”.
Ref: Mazhari P. 167"
reference: البقرة :286
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہم پر وه بوجھ نہ ڈال جس کی ہمیں طاقت نہ ہو اور ہم سے درگزر فرما! اور ہمیں بخش دے اور ہم پر رحم کر! تو ہی ہمارا مالک ہے، ہمیں کافروں کی قوم پر غلبہ عطا فرما

dua_transliteration: Rabbana la tuzigh quloobana ba'da idh hadaytana wa hab lana milladunka rahmah innaka antal Wahhab
english_translation: Our Lord! Cause not our hearts to stray after Thou hast guided us, and bestow upon us mercy from Thy Presence. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Bestower.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تُزِغْ قُلُوبَنَا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَيْتَنَا وَهَبْ لَنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْوَهَّابُ
additional_info:
"1. Aisha (a.s) narrates, Rasulullah (pbuh) used to recite this du`a when awakening in the morning.
Ref: Ibn Kathir Vol. 1. P. 356"
reference: آل عمران :8
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہمیں ہدایت دینے کے بعد ہمارے دل ٹیڑھے نہ کردے اور ہمیں اپنے پاس سے رحمت عطا فرما، یقیناً تو ہی بہت بڑی عطا دینے واﻻ ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana innaka jami'unnasi li-Yawmil la rayba fi innAllaha la yukhliful mi'aad
english_translation: Our Lord! Lo! it is Thou Who gatherest mankind together to a Day of which there is no doubt. Lo! Allah faileth not to keep the tryst.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ جَامِعُ ٱلنَّاسِ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
additional_info:
"1. The ayah (du`a) before this ayah was concerning steadfastness. Subsequently this du`a was not revealed for any worldly motives. It was solely made for the Akhirah and to seek refuge from Jahannum, as our belief is “O Allah You are going to gather us on such a day regarding which there is no doubt”
Ref: Mariful Qur’an - Vol. 2. P. 23"
reference: آل عمران :9
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! تو یقیناً لوگوں کوایک دن جمع کرنے واﻻ ہے جس کے آنے میں کوئی شک نہیں، یقیناً اللہ تعالیٰ وعده خلافی نہیں کرتا

dua_transliteration: Rabbana innana amanna faghfir lana dhunuubana wa qinna 'adhaban-Naar
english_translation: Our Lord! Lo! we believe. So forgive us our sins and guard us from the punishment of Fire
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
additional_info:
"1. Making a du`a of this nature is the quality of (those who fear
Allah) by being cautious regarding the law of shariah."
reference: آل عمران :16
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہم ایمان ﻻ چکے اس لئے ہمارے گناه معاف فرما اور ہمیں آگ کے عذاب سے بچا

dua_transliteration: Rabbana amanna bima anzalta wattaba 'nar-Rusula fak-tubna ma'ash-Shahideen
english_translation: Our Lord! We believe in that which Thou hast revealed and we follow him whom Thou hast sent. Enrol us among those who witness (to the truth).
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا بِمَآ أَنزَلْتَ وَٱتَّبَعْنَا ٱلرَّسُولَ فَٱكْتُبْنَا مَعَ ٱلشَّٰهِدِينَ
additional_info:
"1. This du`a was made by the helpers of Esa (a.s). When Esa (a.s) asked his nation that who amongst them will be his helpers. They agreed and read this du`a as emphasis of their claim.
Ref: Mariful Quran Vol. 2. P. 70"
reference: آل عمران :53
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پالنے والے معبود! ہم تیری اتاری ہوئی وحی پر ایمان ﻻئے اور ہم نے تیرے رسول کی اتباع کی، پس تو ہمیں گواہوں میں لکھ لے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana-ghfir lana dhunuubana wa israfana fi amrina wa thabbit aqdamana wansurna 'alal qawmil kafireen
english_translation: Our Lord! forgive us for our sins and wasted efforts, make our foothold sure, and give us victory over the disbelieving folk.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَإِسْرَافَنَا فِىٓ أَمْرِنَا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
additional_info:
"1. No person can be assured that the good actions he is doing presently will be done continually. Therefore we should express regret on the deficiency of our present actions and make it a habit to make du`a for steadfastness in regard to our future actions. In the above du`a, firstly, forgiveness is being sought for previously committed sins. This is an indication to the fact that whatever difficulties / problems befalls a person, be it in the form of defeat from the enemies or any other problem, is in reality the consequence of a person’s sins. The remedy for which is seeking repentance and forgiveness.
Ref: Mariful Quran Vol. 2. P. 201
2. This ayah teaches us that whenever any calamity befalls a person, then together with utilising physical means, one should also make
du`a and ask for repentance as most of the calamities that befall a person are due to one’s sins.
Ref: Bayanul Qur’an P. 62"
reference: آل عمران :147]"
urdu_translation: اے پروردگار! ہمارے گناہوں کو بخش دے اور ہم سے ہمارے کاموں میں جو بے جا زیادتی ہوئی ہے اسے بھی معاف فرما اور ہمیں ﺛابت قدمی عطا فرما اور ہمیں کافروں کی قوم پر مدد دے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana ma khalaqta hadha batilan Subhanaka faqina 'adhaban-Naar
english_translation: Our Lord! Thou createdst not this in vain. Glory be to Thee! Preserve us from the doom of Fire.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا مَا خَلَقْتَ هَٰذَا بَٰطِلًا سُبْحَٰنَكَ فَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
additional_info: na
reference: [آل عمران :191]
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! تو نے یہ بے فائده نہیں بنایا، تو پاک ہے پس ہمیں آگ کے عذاب سے بچا لے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana innaka man tudkhilin nara faqad akhzaytahu wa ma liDh-dhalimeena min ansar
english_translation: Our Lord! Whom Thou causest to enter the Fire: him indeed Thou hast confounded. For evil-doers there will be no helpers.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ مَن تُدْخِلِ ٱلنَّارَ فَقَدْ أَخْزَيْتَهُۥ ۖ وَمَا لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ مِنْ أَنصَارٍ
additional_info: na
reference: آل عمران :192
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پالنے والے! تو جسے جہنم میں ڈالے یقیناً تو نے اسے رسوا کیا، اور ﻇالموں کا مددگار کوئی نہیں

dua_transliteration: Rabbana innana sami'na munadiyan-yunadi lil-imani an aminu bi Rabbikum fa'aamanna
english_translation: Our Lord! We have heard the call of one calling (Us) to Faith, 'Believe ye in the Lord,' and we have believed.
dua_arabic: رَّبَّنَآ إِنَّنَا سَمِعْنَا مُنَادِيًا يُنَادِى لِلْإِيمَٰنِ أَنْ ءَامِنُوا۟ بِرَبِّكُمْ فَـَٔامَنَّا ۚ
additional_info: na
reference: آل عمران :193
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہم نے سنا کہ منادی کرنے واﻻ بآواز بلند ایمان کی طرف بلا رہا ہے کہ لوگو! اپنے رب پر ایمان لاؤ، پس ہم ایمان ﻻئے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana faghfir lana dhunoobana wa kaffir 'ana sayyi'aatina wa tawaffana ma'al Abrar
english_translation: Our Lord! Therefor forgive us our sins, and remit from us our evil deeds, and make us die the death of the righteous.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَكَفِّرْ عَنَّا سَيِّـَٔاتِنَا وَتَوَفَّنَا مَعَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ
additional_info: na
reference: آل عمران :193
urdu_translation: یا الٰہی اب تو ہمارے گناه معاف فرما اور ہماری برائیاں ہم سے دور کر دے اور ہماری موت نیکوں کے ساتھ کر

dua_transliteration: Rabbana wa 'atina ma wa'adtana 'ala rusulika wa la tukhzina yawmal-Qiyamah innaka la tukhliful mi'aad
english_translation: Our Lord! And give us that which Thou hast promised to us by Thy messengers. Confound us not upon the Day of Resurrection. Lo! Thou breakest not the tryst.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا وَءَاتِنَا مَا وَعَدتَّنَا عَلَىٰ رُسُلِكَ وَلَا تُخْزِنَا يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ ۗ إِنَّكَ لَا تُخْلِفُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
additional_info:
"1. The meaning of these du`a (from 13-17) includes all the
objectives/needs that a person wishes for: The final objective of any person is twofold:
1. Gaining entry into Jannat.
2. Saving onself from the fire of Jahannum.
And for these two objectives, there are two conditions: bedience and Being free from sin. Therefore, it adds up to four
All the above are rendered in the above ayaat
Ref: Bayanul Qur’an Vol. 2. P. 85
2. Rasulullah (pbuh) said “Destruction be to that person who recites these verses and does not ponder regarding them”
Ref: Ayah190 /1 Ibn Kathir Vol. 1. P. 450
3. Abu Hurairah (a.s) narrates, Rasulullah (pbuh) used to recite the last 10 ayaat of Surah Al Imran every night.
Ref: Al Imran Ibn Kathir Vol. 1. P. 451"
reference: آل عمران :194
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پالنے والے معبود! ہمیں وه دے جس کا وعده تو نے ہم سے اپنے رسولوں کی زبانی کیا ہے اور ہمیں قیامت کے دن رسوا نہ کر، یقیناً تو وعده خلافی نہیں کرتا

dua_transliteration: Rabbana aamana faktubna ma' ash-shahideen
english_translation: Our Lord, we believe. Inscribe us as among the witnesses.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱكْتُبْنَا مَعَ ٱلشَّٰهِدِينَ
additional_info:
"1. The word “Amanna” does not refer to the Ahlul-Kitab’s past Iman but it refers to their bringing Iman of the present and being included amongst the group of believers. The word Rabbana clarifies that they are bringing the true Iman and not the superficial
Iman like the hypocrites. By the word “Ash-shahidin” the ummah of Nabi (pbuh) is meant, those who will give testimony regarding the conveyance of the message of Nabi.
Ref: Tafsir Mazhari Vol. 4. P. 18"
reference: المائدة :83
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہم ایمان لے آئے پس تو ہم کو بھی ان لوگوں کے ساتھ لکھ لے جو تصدیق کرتے ہیں

dua_transliteration: Rabbana anzil 'alayna ma'idatam minas-Samai takunu lana 'idal li-awwa-lina wa aakhirna wa ayatam-minka war-zuqna wa anta Khayrul-Raziqeen
english_translation: O Allah, Lord of us! Send down for us a table spread with food from heaven, that it may be a feast for us, for the first of us and for the last of us, and a sign from Thee. Give us sustenance, for Thou art the Best of Sustainers.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ أَنزِلْ عَلَيْنَا مَآئِدَةً مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ تَكُونُ لَنَا عِيدًا لِّأَوَّلِنَا وَءَاخِرِنَا وَءَايَةً مِّنكَ ۖ وَٱرْزُقْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
additional_info:
"1. This du`a was made by Esa (a.s) at the request of his helpers. They requested him to make du`a that Allah send down food from the skies so that they might eat and their hearts can be at ease and be satisfied that Esa (a.s) had spoken regarding his Rabb (Allah). When Esa (a.s) saw that their objective was valid he made this du`a.
Ref: Mariful Qur’an Vol. 3. P. 267"
reference: المائدة :114
urdu_translation: اے اللہ اے ہمارے پروردگار! ہم پر آسمان سے کھانا نازل فرما! کہ وه ہمارے لئے یعنی ہم میں جو اول ہیں اور جو بعد کے ہیں سب کے لئے ایک خوشی کی بات ہوجائے اور تیری طرف سے ایک نشانی ہوجائے اور تو ہم کو رزق عطا فرمادے اور تو سب عطا کرنے والوں سے اچھا ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana zalamna anfusana wa il lam taghfir lana wa tarhamna lana kunana minal-khasireen
english_translation: Our Lord! We have wronged ourselves. If thou forgive us not and have not mercy on us, surely we are of the lost!
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَآ أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْخَٰسِرِينَ
additional_info:
"1. This ayah proved that if a person’s minor sins are not forgiven, he will be punished for it as well.
Ref: Tafsir Mazhari Vol. 4. P. 283"
reference: الأعراف :23
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہم نے اپنا بڑا نقصان کیا اور اگر تو ہماری مغفرت نہ کرے گا اور ہم پر رحم نہ کرے گا تو واقعی ہم نقصان پانے والوں میں سے ہوجائیں گے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana la taj'alna ma'al qawwmi-dhalimeen
english_translation: Our Lord! Place us not with the wrong-doing folk
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا مَعَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
additional_info:
"1. This du`a will be made by the people of “the heights” (between Jannah and Jahannum) when their faces will be turned towards the fire of Jahannum. The meaning of the du`a is that “O Allah do not include us among the dwellers of Jahannum who are all oppressors.”
Ref: Mariful Qur’an Vol. 3. P. 564"
reference: الأعراف :47
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہم کو ان ﻇالم لوگوں کے ساتھ شامل نہ کر

dua_transliteration: Rabbanaf-tah baynana wa bayna qawmina bil haqqi wa anta Khayrul Fatiheen
english_translation: Our Lord! Decide with truth between us and our folk, for Thou art the best of those who make decision.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا ٱفْتَحْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ قَوْمِنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْفَٰتِحِينَ
additional_info:
"1. This du`a was made by Shuaib (a.s) when his nation refused to accept the truth. Shuaib (a.s) turned to Allah making du`a.
Ref: Mariful Qur’an Vol. 3. P. 267
2. In reality Shuaib (a.s) made du`a for the destruction of the rejectors from amongst his nation. Allah accepted this du`a and destroyed the nation by a great tremor.
Ref: Ibid P. 630"
reference: الأعراف :89
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! ہمارے اور ہماری قوم کے درمیان حق کے موافق فیصلہ کر دے اور تو سب سے اچھا فیصلہ کرنے واﻻ ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana afrigh 'alayna sabran wa tawaffana Muslimeen
english_translation: Our Lord! Vouchsafe unto us steadfastness and make us die as men who have surrendered (unto Thee).
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
additional_info:
"1. In this du`a, there is an indication to the fact that if Allah does not wish and will, then man’s courage and hope will be of no use. Therefore du`a is being made for firmness and steadfastness. Because it’s only steadfastness, patience and firmness which can make a person victorious over one’s opponents.
Ref: Mariful Qur’an Vol. 4. P. 37"
reference: الأعراف :126
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہمارے اوپر صبر کا فیضان فرما اور ہماری جان حالت اسلام پر نکال

dua_transliteration: Rabbana la taj'alna fitnatal lil-qawmidh-Dhalimeen wa najjina bi-Rahmatika minal qawmil kafireen
english_translation: Our Lord! Oh, make us not a lure for the wrongdoing folk; (85) And, of Thy mercy, save us from the folk that disbelieve.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِّلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ ﴿٨٥‎﴾ وَنَجِّنَا بِرَحْمَتِكَ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ ﴿٨٦﴾
additional_info:
"1. Before making du`a, having total reliance on Allah is of utmost importance, so that the du`a may be accepted.
Ref: Tafsir Mazhari Vol.5. P. 535"
reference: يونس :85-86
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! ہم کو ان ﻇالموں کے لئے فتنہ نہ بنا  ﴿٨٥‎﴾ اور ہم کو اپنی رحمت سے ان کافر لوگوں سے نجات دے ﴿٨٦﴾

dua_transliteration: Rabbana innaka ta'lamu ma nukhfi wa ma nu'linu wa ma yakhfa 'alal-lahi min shay'in fil-ardi wa la fis-Sama'
english_translation: Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the heaven.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ تَعْلَمُ مَا نُخْفِى وَمَا نُعْلِنُ ۗ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ
additional_info:
"1. This was the du`a of Ibrahim (a.s).
2. Ibn Abbas (a.s) says it refers to the sadness of leaving Ismail u and his mother in a barren land.
Ref: Tafsir Mazhari Vol. 6. P. 316"
reference: إبرهيم :38
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! تو خوب جانتا ہے جو ہم چھپائیں اور جو ﻇاہر کریں۔ زمین و آسمان کی کوئی چیز اللہ پر پوشیده نہیں

dua_transliteration: Rabbana wa taqabbal Du'a
english_translation: our Lord! and accept my prayer
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَآءِ
additional_info:
"1. In Tirmidhi there is a narration wherein Rasulullah (pbuh) says “Du`a is Ibadah”
2. Anas (a.s) narrates that Nabi(pbuh) has said: Du`a is the essence (marrow) of Ibadah.
Ref: Tafsir Mazhari Vol. 6. P. 317"
reference: إبرهيم :40
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب میری دعا قبول فرما

dua_transliteration: Rabbana ghfir li wa li wallidayya wa lil Mu'mineena yawma yaqumul hisaab
english_translation: Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents and believers on the day when the account is cast.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلْحِسَابُ
additional_info:
"1. This is also the du`a of Ibrahim (a.s).
2. From these a yaat that appear before this
du`a we learn the etiquettes of du`a, it must be made with utmost humility and humbleness - also, the praises and glorification of Allah should be made with du`a. By this, there is a greater possibility that the du`a will be accepted.
Ref: Mariful Qur’an Vol. 5. 256"
reference: إبرهيم :41
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! مجھے بخش دے اور میرے ماں باپ کو بھی بخش اور دیگر مومنوں کو بھی بخش جس دن حساب ہونے لگے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana 'atina mil-ladunka Rahmataw wa hayyi lana min amrina rashada
english_translation: Our Lord! Give us mercy from Thy presence, and shape for us right conduct in our plight.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا
additional_info: 1. This du`a was made by the companions of the cave when they took refuge in the cave.
reference: الكهف :10
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! ہمیں اپنے پاس سے رحمت عطا فرما اور ہمارے کام میں ہمارے لئے راه یابی کو آسان کردے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana innana nakhafu any-yafruta 'alayna aw any-yatgha
english_translation: Our Lord! Lo! we fear that he may be beforehand with us or that he may play the tyrant.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَن يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَآ أَوْ أَن يَطْغَىٰ
additional_info: 1. This was the du`a that Musa (a.s) and Harun (a.s) made to Allah before going to Firoun.
reference: طه :45
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! ہمیں خوف ہے کہ کہیں فرعون ہم پر کوئی زیادتی نہ کرے یا اپنی سرکشی میں بڑھ نہ جائے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana amanna faghfir lana warhamna wa anta khayrur Rahimiin
english_translation: Our Lord! Lo! we fear that he may be beforehand with us or that he may play the Our Lord! We believe, therefor forgive us and have mercy on us for Thou art Best of all who show mercy.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
additional_info:
"1. This is a du`a made by a group of Muslims. They used to continuously make this du`a.
2. In this du`a the believers are addressing Allah by saying, “O Allah we have brought Iman, hence for give us and have mercy on us”."
reference: المؤمنون :109
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! ہم ایمان ﻻچکے ہیں تو ہمیں بخش اور ہم پر رحم فرما تو سب مہربانوں سے زیاده مہربان ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbanas-rif 'anna 'adhaba jahannama inna 'adhabaha kana gharama innaha sa'at musta-qarranw wa muqama
english_translation: Our Lord! Avert from us the doom of hell; lo! the doom thereof is anguish; Lo! it is wretched as abode and station
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا ٱصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا ﴿٦٥﴾ إِنَّهَا سَآءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا ﴿٦٦﴾
additional_info:
"1. This du`a is a supplication which should be continuously made by the believers. Because one of their qualities, is that despite being obedient to Allah, they still remain in fear regarding the punishment of Allah, and regarding the Akhirah. Because of this fear they become practical, and continue making du`a.
Ref: Mariful Qur’an. Vol. 6. P. 504
2. Ali (a.s) narrates that Nabi (pbuh) has said: Allah sent wahi to one Nabi of the Bani Israil (i.e. Dawud a.s) “Tell the obedient servants from your ummah not to only rely on their good actions, as on the day of reckoning, whichever servant I wish to punish I will punish in conformance to my (justice) and tell the disobedient servants not to throw themselves into destruction by their own hands (i.e. they should not give up hope of forgiveness) as I will forgive major sins also if I wish, and I will not care (i.e. in giving anybody punishment or forgiving anybody - Abu Naim.)
Ref: Tafsir Mazhari Vol. 8 P. 486"
reference: الفرقان :65-66
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! ہم سے دوزخ کا عذاب پرے ہی پرے رکھ، کیونکہ اس کا عذاب چمٹ جانے واﻻ ہے ﴿٦٥﴾ بے شک وه ٹھہرنے اور رہنے کے لحاظ سے بدترین جگہ ہے ﴿٦٦﴾

dua_transliteration: Rabbana Hablana min azwaajina wadhurriy-yatina, qurrata 'ayionin wa-jalna lil-muttaqeena Imaama
english_translation: Our Lord! Vouchsafe us comfort of our wives and of our offspring, and make us patterns for (all) those who ward off (evil).
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَٰجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّٰتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَٱجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
additional_info:
"1. Regarding the “coolness of the eyes” Hasan Basri states: The original coolness of the eyes is to see a persons family involved in the obedience of Allah. The health and welfare and happiness of the family is also included in it.
Ref: Mariful Qur’an Vol. 6. P. 509
2. Allah’s chosen servants are not only concerned with their own
reformation and are satisfied by their good deeds alone. They are also concerned with the reformation and actions of their wives and children. They continue to make an effort in this regard, and part of their effort is to make du`a also.
Ref: Ibid
3. Qurtubi states: There can be nothing more soothing / cooling to the eyes than seeing a person’s wife and children being obedient to Allah
Ref: Mazhari Vol. 8 P. 499
“Coolness of the eyes”
4. Coolness of eyes
Ikramah says: The Mufassirin have not taken the meaning of
beauty and grace. But they say it means “to be obedient to Allah.
Ref: Ibn Kathir Vol. 3 P. 342"
reference: الفرقان :74
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! تو ہمیں ہماری بیویوں اور اوﻻد سے آنکھوں کی ٹھنڈک عطا فرما اور ہمیں پرہیزگاروں کا پیشوا بنا

dua_transliteration: Rabbana la Ghafurun shakur
english_translation: Our Lord is Forgiving, Bountiful
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا لَغَفُورٌ شَكُورٌ
additional_info:
"1. When the dwellers of Jannah will be entering Jannah, they will be saying the above.
Ref: Mariful Qur’an Vol. 7 P. 350
2. Ibn Umar (a.s) narrates that Nabi (pbuh) has said: The reciters of the kalimah will have no fear at the time of death, nor will they experience fear in the grave, nor on the plains of reckoning. I am seeing them wiping the dust off their heads (at the time of arising from their graves) and they will be saying the above.
Ref: Ibn Kathir Vol. 3 P. 565 by Tabarani"
reference: فاطر :34
urdu_translation: ہمارا پروردگار بڑا بخشنے واﻻ بڑا قدردان ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana wasi'ta kulla shai'inr Rahmatanw wa 'ilman faghfir lilladhina tabu wattaba'u sabilaka waqihim 'adhabal-Jahiim
english_translation: Our Lord! Thou comprehendest all things in mercy and knowledge, therefor forgive those who repent and follow Thy way. Ward off from them the punishment of hell.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا وَسِعْتَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ رَّحْمَةً وَعِلْمًا فَٱغْفِرْ لِلَّذِينَ تَابُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ سَبِيلَكَ وَقِهِمْ عَذَابَ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
additional_info:
"1. Those angels who carry the Throne of Allah make this du`a for the Muminin.
2. Mutif Bin Abdullah says: The most well wishing creation towards the believers are the angels and the most deceiving is Shaytan.
Ref: Mazhari Vol. 10 P. 219"
reference: غافر :7
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار! تو نے ہر چیز کو اپنی بخشش اور علم سے گھیر رکھا ہے، پس تو انہیں بخش دے جو توبہ کریں اور تیری راه کی پیروی کریں اور تو انہیں دوزخ کے عذاب سے بھی بچا لے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana wa adhkhilhum Jannati 'adninil-lati wa'adatahum wa man salaha min aba'ihim wa azwajihim wa dhuriyyatihim innaka antal 'Azizul-Hakimu, waqihimus sayyi'ati wa man taqis-sayyi'ati yawma'idhin faqad rahimtahu wa dhalika huwal fawzul-'Adheem
english_translation: Our Lord! And make them enter the Gardens of Eden which thou hast promised them, with such of their fathers and their wives and their descendants as do right. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Mighty, the Wise. (8) And ward off from them ill-deeds; and he from whom Thou wardest off ill-deeds that day, him verily hast Thou taken into mercy. That is the supreme triumph.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا وَأَدْخِلْهُمْ جَنَّٰتِ عَدْنٍ ٱلَّتِى وَعَدتَّهُمْ وَمَن صَلَحَ مِنْ ءَابَآئِهِمْ وَأَزْوَٰجِهِمْ وَذُرِّيَّٰتِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ ﴿٨﴾ وَقِهِمُ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ ۚ وَمَن تَقِ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ يَوْمَئِذٍ فَقَدْ رَحِمْتَهُۥ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ ﴿٩﴾
additional_info:
"1. This is also the du`a of the angels for the believers.
2. Saeed bin Jubair (a.s) narrates: When a person will enter Jannah, he will enquire regarding the abode of his father / brother and son. It will be said to him: “They did not reach your status as far as good deeds are concerned. ”The person will reply, “The good deeds I used to do were for myself as well as for them”. Hence they will be joined with him. Thereafter Saeed (a.s) recited the above ayah.
Ref: Ibn Kathir Vol. 4 P. 78"
reference: غافر :8-9
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! تو انہیں ہمیشگی والی جنتوں میں لے جا جن کا تو نے ان سے وعده کیا ہے اور ان کے باپ دادوں اور بیویوں اور اوﻻد میں سے (بھی) ان (سب) کو جو نیک عمل ہیں۔ یقیناً تو تو غالب و باحکمت ہے ﴿٨﴾ انہیں برائیوں سے بھی محفوظ رکھ، حق تو یہ ہے کہ اس دن تونے جسے برائیوں سے بچا لیا اس پر تو نے رحمت کر دی اور بہت بڑی کامیابی تو یہی ہے ﴿٩﴾

dua_transliteration: Rabban-agh’fir lana wa li 'ikhwani nalladhina sabaquna bil imani wa la taj'al fi qulubina ghillal-lilladhina amanu
english_translation: Our Lord! Forgive us, and our brethren who came before us into the Faith, and leave not, in our hearts, rancour (or sense of injury) against those who have believed.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلِإِخْوَٰنِنَا ٱلَّذِينَ سَبَقُونَا بِٱلْإِيمَٰنِ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ فِى قُلُوبِنَا غِلًّا لِّلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟
additional_info:
"“Al-ladhina-amanu” refers to the Muhajirin and Ansar:
1. Those angels who carry the Throne of Allah make this du`a for the Muminin.
2. Mutif Bin Abdullah says: The most well wishing creation towards the believers are the
angels and the most deceiving is Shaytan.
Ref: Mazhari Vol. 10 P. 219"
reference: الحشر :10
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار ہمیں بخش دے اور ہمارے ان بھائیوں کو بھی جو ہم سے پہلے ایمان ﻻچکے ہیں اور ایمان داروں کی طرف سے ہمارے دل میں کینہ (اور دشمنی) نہ ڈال

dua_transliteration: Rabbana innaka Ra'ufur Rahim
english_translation: Our Lord! Thou art indeed Full of Kindness, Most Merciful.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ رَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
additional_info:
"1. “Al-ladhina-amanu” refers to the Muhajirin and Ansar.
2. Those angels who carry the Throne of Allah make this du`a for the Muminin.
3. Mutif Bin Abdullah says: The most well wishing creation towards the believers are the angels and the most deceiving is Shaytan
Ref: Mazhari Vol. 10 P. 219"
reference: الحشر :10
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب بیشک تو شفقت ومہربانی کرنے واﻻ ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana 'alayka tawakkalna wa-ilayka anabna wa-ilaykal masir
english_translation: Our Lord! In Thee do we trust, and to Thee do we turn in repentance: to Thee is (our) Final Goal
dua_arabic: رَّبَّنَا عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
additional_info:
"1. This was the du`a of Ibrahim (a.s) and his followers.
2. This du`a means: O Allah in all matters we put our trust in You, and we hand over all our matters to You.
Ref: Ibn Kathir Vol. 4. P. 372"
reference: الممتحنة :4
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے پروردگار تجھی پر ہم نے بھروسہ کیا ہے اور تیری ہی طرف رجوع کرتے ہیں اور تیری ہی طرف لوٹنا ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana la taj'alna fitnatal lilladhina kafaru waghfir lana Rabbana innaka antal 'Azizul-Hakim
english_translation: Our Lord! Make us not a (test and) trial for the Unbelievers, but forgive us, our Lord! for Thou art the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا رَبَّنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
additional_info:
"1. This is also part of the du`a made by Ibrahim (a.s) and his followers. Mujahid (R.A) states that this ayah means: “Do not punish us through the hands of the kuffaar nor give us adhab (punishment) directly, other wise the kuffaar will say that if these people were true believers, then no adhab would befall them”.
Ref: Mazhari Vol. P. 431"
reference: الممتحنة :5
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب! تو ہمیں کافروں کی آزمائش میں نہ ڈال اور اے ہمارے پالنے والے ہماری خطاؤں کو بخش دے، بیشک تو ہی غالب، حکمت واﻻ ہے

dua_transliteration: Rabbana atmim lana nurana waghfir lana innaka 'ala kulli shai-in qadir
english_translation: Our Lord! Perfect our Light for us, and grant us Forgiveness: for Thou hast power over all things.
dua_arabic: رَبَّنَآ أَتْمِمْ لَنَا نُورَنَا وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
additional_info:
"1. Mujahid states that the Believers will recite this du`a at the time when they will see that the celestial light of the Hypocrites had disappeared on the day of Qiyamah.
Ref: Ibn Kathir Vol. 4 P. 418/9
2. On the bridge of Sirat the Believers will see (Nur) celestial light in front of them as well as on their right hand side. When they will see that the (Nur) celestial light of the Hypocrites has disappeared they will recite this du`a. The (Nur) celestial light will be in proportion to a persons actions. Therefore the du`a is being made to perfect the celestial light.
Ref: Mazhari Vol. 11 P. 594"
reference: التحريم :8
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب ہمیں کامل نور عطا فرما اور ہمیں بخش دے یقیناً تو ہر چیز پر قادر ہے

dua_transliteration: lab-bayk-allaahumma labbayk, labbayka laa shareeka laka labbayk, innal-hamda wan-ni‛mata laka wal mulk, laa shareeka lak, (lab-bayka ilaah-al-haq lab-bayk)
english_translation: Here I am O Allah, (in response to Your call), here I am. Here I am, You have no partner, here I am. Indeed all praise, grace and sovereignty belong to You. You have no partner. (Here I am O God in Truth, here I am.)
dua_title: Talbiyah chant of Hajj and Umrah
dua_arabic: لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ ، لَبَّيْكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ ، إِنَّ الْحَمْدَ والنِّعْمَةَ لَكَ وَالْمُلْكُ ، لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ (إِلَهَ الْحَقِّ لَبَّيْكَ)
additional_info:
"Narrated `Abdullah bin `Umar:
The Talbiya of Allah's Messenger  (May peace be upon him) was : 'Labbaika Allahumma labbaik, Labbaika la sharika Laka labbaik, Inna-l-hamda wan-ni'mata Laka walmulk, La sharika Laka' (I respond to Your call O Allah, I respond to Your call, and I am obedient to Your orders, You have no partner, I respond to Your call All the praises and blessings are for You, All the sovereignty is for You, And You have no partners with you."
reference:
"Reference 1: Sahih al-Bukhari 1549
In-book reference: Book 25, Hadith 35
English translation: Vol. 2, Book 26, Hadith 621
(Deprecated numbering scheme)
"
urdu_translation: حاضر ہوں اے اللہ ! حاضر ہوں میں . تیرا کوئی شریک نہیں ۔ حاضر ہوں ، تمام حمد تیرے ہی لیے ہے اور تمام نعمتیں تیری ہی طرف سے ہیں ، بادشاہت تیری ہی ہے تیرا کوئی شریک نہیں ۔

dua_transliteration: allaahu akbar
english_translation: Allah is the greatest
dua_arabic: اللهُ أَكْبَرُ
additional_info:
"Narrated Ibn `Abbas:
The Prophet  (May peace be upon him) performed Tawaf of the Ka`ba riding a camel, and every time he came in front of the Corner (having the Black Stone), he pointed towards it with something he had with him and said Takbir."
reference:
"Reference 1: Sahih al-Bukhari 1613
In-book reference: Book 25, Hadith 99
English translation: Vol. 2, Book 26, Hadith 682
(deprecated numbering scheme)
"
urdu_translation: اللہ سب سے بڑا ہے

dua_transliteration: allaahu akbar
english_translation: Allah is the greatest.
dua_arabic: اللهُ أَكْبَرُ
additional_info:
"Narrated Salim:
Ibn `Umar used to do Rami of the Jamrat-ud-Dunya (the Jamra near to the Khaif mosque) with seven small stones and used to recite Takbir on throwing every pebble. He then would go ahead till he reached the level ground where he would stand facing the Qibla for a long time to invoke (Allah) while raising his hands (while invoking). Then he would do Rami of the Jamrat-ul-Wusta (middle Jamra) and then he would go to the left towards the middle ground, where he would stand facing the Qibla. He would remain standing there for a long period to invoke (Allah) while raising his hands, and would stand there for a long period. Then he would do Rami of the Jamrat-ul-Aqaba from the middle of the valley, but he would not stay by it, and then he would leave and say, ""I saw the Prophet  (May peace be upon him) doing like this."
reference:
"Reference 1: Sahih al-Bukhari 1751
In-book reference: Book 25, Hadith 229
English translation: Vol. 2, Book 26, Hadith 807
"
urdu_translation: اللہ سب سے بڑا ہے

dua_transliteration: rabbanaa aatinaa fiddunyaa hasanatan wa fil aakhirati hasanatan wa qinaa ‛adhaab-an-naar
english_translation: O our Lord, grant us the best in this life and the best in the next life, and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.
dua_title: Dua said between Yamaani corner and black stone
dua_arabic: رَبَّـنَا آتِنَا فِي الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ
additional_info:
"Narrated Abdullah ibn as-Sa'ib:
I heard the Messenger of Allah  (May peace be upon him) say between the two corners: O Allah, bring us a blessing in this world and a blessing in the next and guard us from punishment of Hell."
reference:
"Reference 1: Sunan Abi Dawud 1892
In-book reference: Book 11, Hadith 172
English translation: Book 10, Hadith 1887
"
urdu_translation: اے ہمارے رب ! ہمیں دنیا میں بھلائی عطا فرما ، اور آخرت میں بھی ، اور ہمیں جہنم کے عذاب سے بچا لے

dua_transliteration: Alhamdu Lillaahil-Lathee 'Aafaanee Mimmab-Talaaka Bihi Wa Fadhdhalanee 'Alaa Katheerin Mimman Khalaqa Tafdheela
english_translation: Praise is to Allah Who has spared me what He has afflicted you with, and preferred me greatly above much of what He has created
dua_title: When seeing someone afflicted by misfortune
dua_arabic: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ الَّذِي عَافَانِي مِمَّا ابْتَلَاكَ بِهِ، وَفَضَّلَنِي عَلَى كَثِيرٍ مِمَّنْ خَلَقَ تَفْضِيلًا
additional_info:
"Umar narrated that:
The Messenger of Allah (May peace be upon him) said: “Whoever sees a person afflicted and say: ‘All praise is due to Allah Who saved me from that which He has afflicted you with, and blessed me greatly over many of those whom He has created, (Al-ḥamdulillāhi alladhī `āfānī mimmabtalāka bihī wa faḍḍalanī `alā kathīrin mimman khalaqa tafḍīla)’ then he shall be saved from that affliction for as long as he lives.”
reference:
"Jami` at-Tirmidhi 3431
In-book reference: Book 48, Hadith 62
English reference: Vol. 6, Book 45, Hadith 3431"
urdu_translation: تمام تعریفیں اسی ذات کے لیے ہیں۔جس نے مجھے اس مصیبت سے نجات دی جس میں تجھے مبتلا کیا اور مجھے اپنی اکثر مخلوق پر فضیلت دی۔

dua_transliteration: allaahumma innee as’aluka min fadhlik
english_translation: O Allah, I ask You from Your favor
dua_arabic: ٱللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ
additional_info: Narrated Abu Huraira: The Prophet (May peace be upon him) said, "When you hear the crowing of cocks, ask for Allah's Blessings for (their crowing indicates that) they have seen an angel. And when you hear the braying of donkeys, seek Refuge with Allah from Satan for (their braying indicates) that they have seen a Satan."
reference: "Sahih al-Bukhari 3303, In-book reference : Book 59, Hadith 111, USC-MSA web (English) reference : Vol. 4, Book 54, Hadith 522
urdu_translation: اے اللہ میں تجھ سے تیرا فضل مانگتا ہوں

dua_transliteration: Rabbighfir li wa tub alai innaka antattawwabur ghafoor
english_translation: My Lord, forgive me and accept my repentance, You are the Ever-Relenting, the All-Forgiving.
dua_arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي ، وَتُبْ عَلَيَّ ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ التَّوَّابُ الْغَفُورُ
additional_info:
"Narrated Abdullah ibn Umar:
We counted that the Messenger of Allah (May peace be upon him) would say a hundred times during a meeting: ""My Lord, forgive me and pardon me; Thou art the Pardoning and forgiving One".
reference:
"Reference: Sunan Abi Dawud 1516
In-book reference: Book 8, Hadith 101
English translation: Book 8, Hadith 1511"
urdu_translation: اے میرے رب ! مجھے بخش دے ، میری توبہ قبول کر ، تو ہی توبہ قبول کرنے والا اور رحم فرمانے والا ہے

dua_transliteration: allaahumma innee as’aluka min fadlik
english_translation: O Allah, I ask You from Your favor
dua_title: Dua upon hearing a rooster crow
dua_arabic: ٱللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ
additional_info: Narrated Abu Huraira: The Prophet (May peace be upon him) said, "When you hear the crowing of cocks, ask for Allah's Blessings for (their crowing indicates that) they have seen an angel. And when you hear the braying of donkeys, seek Refuge with Allah from Satan for (their braying indicates) that they have seen a Satan."
reference: Sahih al-Bukhari 3303, In-book reference : Book 59, Hadith 111, USC-MSA web (English) reference : Vol. 4, Book 54, Hadith 522
urdu_translation: اے اللہ، میں تجھ سے تیرا فضل مانگتا ہوں

dua_transliteration: allaahumma aslih lee deeni al-ladhi huwa ‛is-matu amree, wa aslih lee dun-yaaial-lati feeha ma‛aashee, wa aslih lee aakhiratee al-lati feeha ma‛aadee, waj-‛alil, hayaata zyaadatan lee fee kulli khair, wal-mawta raahatan lee min kulli shar
english_translation: O Allah perfect for me my religion on which success of all my affairs depends, and perfect my worldly affairs on which my livelihood depends, and perfect my hereafter to which I will return, and make in life for me an increase of all good, and make death for me a comfort from all evil.
dua_title: Dua and remembrance to be said any time
dua_arabic: ٱللَّهُمَّ أَصْلِحْ لِي دِينِي الَّذِي هُوَ عِصْمَةُ أَمْرِي, وَأَصْلِحْ لِي دُنْيَايَ الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَاشِي, وَأَصْلِحْ لِي آخِرَتِي الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَادِي, وَاجْعَلِ الْحَيَاةَ زِيَادَةً لِي فِي كُلِّ خَيْرٍ،, وَاجْعَلِ الْمَوْتَ رَاحَةً لِي مِنْ كُلِّ شَرٍّ
additional_info: O Allah, set right for me my religion which is the safeguard of my affairs. And set right for me the affairs of my world wherein is my living. And set right for me my Hereafter on which depends my after-life. And make the life for me (a source) of abundance for every good and make my death a source of comfort for me protecting me against every evil
reference: Sahih Muslim 2720, In-book reference : Book 48, Hadith 96, USC-MSA web (English) reference : Book 35, Hadith 6565
urdu_translation: اے اللہ میرے دین کو درست فرما جو میرے معاملات کا محافظ ہے اور میری دنیا کو درست فرما جس میں میرا لوٹنا ہے اور میری زندگی کو ہربھلائی میں میرے لئے زیا د تی کا باعث بنا دے اور موت کو میرے لئے ہر شر سے راحت بنا دے۔

dua_transliteration: allaahumma fa ayyumaa mu’minin sababtuhu faj‛al dhaalika lahu qurbatan ilayka yawm-al-qiyaamah
english_translation: O Allah, any believer whom I have insulted, let that be cause to draw him near to You on the Day of Resurrection
dua_title: Dua for the one you have insulted
dua_arabic: ٱللَّهُمَّ فَأَيُّمَا مُؤْمِنٍ سَبَبْتُهُ فَاجْعَلْ ذَلِكَ لَهُ قُرْبَةً إِلَيْكَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ
additional_info: Narrated Abu Huraira: that he heard the Prophet (May peace be upon him) saying, "O Allah! If I should ever abuse a believer, please let that be a means of bringing him near to You on the Day of Resurrection."
reference: "Sahih al-Bukhari 6361, In-book reference : Book 80, Hadith 58, USC-MSA web (English) reference : Vol. 8, Book 75, Hadith 372
urdu_translation: اے اللہ ! میں نے جس مومن کو بھی برا بھلا کہا ہو تو اس کے لئے اسے قیامت کے دن اپنی قربت کا ذریعہ بنا دے ۔
